description:
It is not possible to get it work. You will get the output:

"This application failed to start because it could not find or load the Qt platform plugin "xcb"
in "".

Reinstalling the application may fix this problem.
Aborted (core dumped)
"

I'am waiting for an update.
I agree that it's nice to see an attempt at Linux-based DMR programming tools, unfortunately, the reported issue still exists, even after manually installing the xcb package.

...it's not working with Ubuntu 20.04 LTE and Anytone 878; Message "...no device found", although a) USB is activated and b) original data cable is in use. I remove the Snap because of no functionality for my setup, sorry.

I followed the instructions on installing from https://dm3mat.darc.de/qdmr/install.html and it detected my radio right away. I have installed qdmr from both snap and from Hannes' reository in ubuntu on my pc and on a raspberry pi 4 with no issues. A bit of a learning curve but downloaded the cp from my radion made some changes added some channels,contacts,tg's and some analog channels. uploaded the cp back to the radio and worked well. I then uploaded the new cp to all 3 of my radios without any problems.
summary: I got this working for my RD-5R

description: Findet zwar den tranceiver aber downlod findet nicht statt.
